ca.ualberta.lard.test

Class CommentModelTests

  • java.lang.Object
      • ca.ualberta.lard.test.CommentModelTests

  • public class CommentModelTests
extends
    JUnit tests for Comment model. Tests creation of a new comment, updating elements of the created comment, and helper functions to get useful information about the comment such as if it is saved locally.
    Author:
    Victoria

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommentModelTests() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testAuthor()
      Tests updating the author field of a Comment.
      void testChildren()
      Tests that a comment has no children upon creation.
      void testConstructors()
      Tests the creation of a Comment.
      void testIsLocal()
      Tests that a newly created comment is not saved locally unless the DataModel is told to save it locally.
      void testLocation()
      Tests that the GeoLocation of a comment can updated to a new location.
      void testParent()
      Tests that a Comment has no parent by default and returns false when asked if it has a parent.
      void testPicture()
      Tests that a newly created comment has picture set to null by default and returns false when asked if it has a picture.
      void testSetBodyText()
      Tests updating the text of a comment.
      void testToString()
      Tests that Comment.toString returns the same text as Comment.bodyText.
      void testUpdatedAt()
      Tests that when a comment is updated, the date it was updated is set to the current date.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommentModelTests

        public CommentModelTests()

    • Method Detail

      • testConstructors

        public void testConstructors()
        Tests the creation of a Comment. All fields should have a value on creation with the exception of picture and parent. Picture is null until a picture is attached. Parent remains null if it is a top level comment.

      • testAuthor

        public void testAuthor()
        Tests updating the author field of a Comment. First tests "updating" the author to the same name. Next updating the author with a new name is tested. Finally, trying to update the author name to nothing should update it to anonymous.

      • testSetBodyText

        public void testSetBodyText()
        Tests updating the text of a comment. First tests "updating" the text to the same text. Next texts updating the text to different text. Finally, trying to update the text to nothing should update it to [Comment Text Removed].

      • testUpdatedAt

        public void testUpdatedAt()
        Tests that when a comment is updated, the date it was updated is set to the current date.

      • testLocation

        public void testLocation()
        Tests that the GeoLocation of a comment can updated to a new location.

      • testPicture

        public void testPicture()
        Tests that a newly created comment has picture set to null by default and returns false when asked if it has a picture. When a user attaches a picture, the same picture should be stored in the picture field of Comment and it will return true when asked if it has a picture.

      • testParent

        public void testParent()
        Tests that a Comment has no parent by default and returns false when asked if it has a parent. Next, tests that the Comment can be updated to have a parent and returns true when asked if it has a parent.

      • testIsLocal

        public void testIsLocal()
        Tests that a newly created comment is not saved locally unless the DataModel is told to save it locally.

      • testToString

        public void testToString()
        Tests that Comment.toString returns the same text as Comment.bodyText.

      • testChildren

        public void testChildren()
        Tests that a comment has no children upon creation. Having no children means the number of children a comment has is zero and when asked for a list of its children it returns null. When a comment has children, this means that when asked about its children it returns a list with at least 1 comment.
